Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: recumbentrider
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel only for one night and it represents a great value. A newer property with very clean and contemporary decor. Secure parking is available underground although we had already parked on the side. Hotel is very convenient to the airport with easy access via expressway to Downtown Miami and South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport... Maybe too close!”
Reviews.Author: Cameron06820
Reviews.Content: About a one minute drive from the airport exit is a cluster of Marriott brands. This Fairfield Inn is the cheapest, but far from the worst. The property is new, clean and well maintained. There's a tiny whirlpool on the second floor but no swimming pool per se. Parking is under and around the ground floor, much of it at a 45 degree slant making walking and luggage transfer a challenge. Only real downside... you're right under the take-off path from the runway. Those big jets are close, loud and fly late into the night. If you're a light sleeper or in anyway paranoid about having a 747 end up in your bedroom, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Frobozz
Reviews.Content: It's an airport hotel, and airport hotels to me are basically places where you stay a night or two en route to somewhere else, or perhaps for a few days on business. This hotel serves these purposes very well. Rooms are modern-looking, clean and very comfortable. Staff is friendly and seemed well-trained; free continental breakfast was the standard issue for this sort of hotel and perfectly fine (yogurt, fruit, waffles, scrambled eggs, cereal, etc.). Nearby casual seafood and Cuban restaurants are OK -- the Catch of the Day restaurant across the street has a long happy hour, cheap seafood and is a decent place to burn a few hours. The area, as might be expected for an airport-area neighborhood, is dreary and somewhat run-down. If it wasn't for the tropical plants, the whole area would look like 40 other airport neighborhoods in America. Of course, you can't blame the hotel for any of that.. Rack rates here are higher than you'll see in some mid-range Miami Beach hotels, which is silly, but rooms sometimes can be booked through third parties at a substantial discount (I paid $70 via AAA for a room that was listed on the hotel site at $190). There's a tiny, but cute, whirlpool-style pool on the premises and a nice exercise room. I stayed here for one night before a cruise. The front desk helped arrange cruise port transportation for me -- a limo-bus for $12 (I think) a person.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel for pre-cruise stay. (Had shuttle/taxi problem)”
Reviews.Author: JerseyBeachcomber
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel over others for a pre-cruise stay from reviews here on TA. This is a good, clean, attractive hotel with some nice amenities. It's good for a night or 2. Would not stay here for a week. The good-----Real nice room with comfortable bed, nice rooms features, and modern bath. Clean as a whistle. The morning breakfast was a nice touch. Use AAA or AARP for discount. It is just a mile or 2 from the airport. The desk ladies in the morning were very helpful. The bad-----The free shuttle pick up is a good thing, but on our time, a friday at 9pm. was upsetting. I called the hotel upon arrival, and told that driver would be right over (only a mile away). Well it took four more calls, and 35 minutes later, we finally get picked up. Got a different story each time I called. In the morning gave planty of notice for a taxi pickup. It was 30 minutes late. So be aware of their possible poor timing & poor excuses. Be aware also,of loud music from across the street & airplane noise, We were on the fifth floor on the west side. Good tip-----No dining facility/bar here. We walked about five minutes over to the Marriott next door, and had a good meal & drinks at their Champions Sports Bar. On the whole, it's good for a one night stay only.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop before your cruise from Miami”
Reviews.Author: mrscleo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel prior to a cruise in January. The rooms are clean and very stylish. The breakfast had excellent selections, including a sausage on a stick covered with pancake batter, delicious. We loved it. The shuttle to the port was $12 each, and we took a taxi back to the hotel after the cruise becuase the room rate included keeping the car for a week. This greatly helped with expenses. Also, if you need to leave your car extra days it is only $10 a day. Exceptional hotel, much better than other places we have stayed in Miami. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stop over for cruise”
Reviews.Author: vaquilter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after arriving in Miami the day before a cruise out of the Port of Miami. This hotel was part of a package deal from the internet travel company I used to book the cruise. I am mid 50's, professional and from Virginia. We arrived in Miami and called the hotel for the pickup from the airport. We were promised the pickup in approximately 30-40 minutes and that was true. We were picked up and delivered to the hotel by a very nice man who pointed out good places to eat close to the hotel. We were promised a ride to the Port of Miami the next day and were told what time to be in the lobby for transport. Check in was quick and we found the room to be very nice, beds were comfortable (I'm very picky about beds) and the room was clean and neat. The shower was nice and adjustable and the bathroom was clean and modern. The room overall I would rate at a 5 on a scale of 0-5. It was quiet and restful. The driver had mentioned that the restaurant across the street was a good place to eat. It was called, "The Catch of the Day" a combination sports bar and outdoor eating establishment. We had dinner there, outside to enjoy the warm weather and asked the waiter what was their recommendation. He recommended the Jumbalia (sp) and it was an excellent recommendation as it was thoroughly enjoyed by both of us. Our night was restful, quiet and uneventful after dinner and we were downstairs at the appropriate time for the trip to the Port in the morning. The transport was there as promised and we were taken to the Port. All in all, this was a very nice hotel and we enjoyed our stay here. We would positively stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A real find near Miami especially for cruise passengers”
Reviews.Author: CarlJohn
Reviews.Content: An excellent package of well-appointed room, great facilities and extremely reasonable price with free shuttle to nearby Miami International Airport. My wife and I stayed there at the end of a Caribbean cruise. Take away food and wine/beer were available from reception, ice was on tap and a comprehensive continental breakfast was included. We caught the bus to downtown Miami (and enjoyed a walk around Little Havana). We also visited restaurants across the road from the hotel. Miami hotels are not low-priced and this was one out of the box.

Reviews.Title: “Best quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: bennyboy50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Dec. 31st, 2011, for 1 night, 4 adults, prior for embarkation to our great cruise on new year's day. Best kept secret Hotel in Miami, for quality, parking facilities and money spent. Left my new car for one week, indoor, clean parking and safe. This Hotel is ''fairly new'' I would return without hesitation !! They do offer pretty decent free breakfast in the morning for all members of our party, lots of food, clean and sufficient room to accomodate many people. I used Stay 123 for our booking, we got excellent price and room as expected ! would use again !!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the dollars!”
Reviews.Author: MultiTripper
Reviews.Content: It took me 3 days to search for a hotel in Miami that was in a decent location and affordable. This hotel was a good place for a 2 day pre cruise stay. A mall nearby and plenty of places to eat. Hotel breakfast was amazing - on first look it didnt seem to have much then when you looked into the fridge you realised there was a big choice. Heat up your own Jimmy Deans muffin in the microwave, toast bagels or muffins,cereals,fresh fruit and yogurts..... Too much for one breakfast sitting! Staff were so helpful - gave us directions to the shops and arranged our cruise shuttle. The shuttle from the airport was free. Just stand outside arrivals and flag the Marriot Fairfield bus down when he drives along. The room was nice and big and had good facilities. The only downside - there was no sun on the pool so I never got a swim - the pool area looked nice too. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Don't Judge This Book By Its Cover”
Reviews.Author: Uncbears21
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks nice from the outside and when you walk into the lobby. Staff was very friendly and helped set up a ride to the cruise terminal when we needed it. But, when we walked into our room, there was a nice booger stuck on the wall in the bathroom, no bathmat in the tub, which caused my grandpa to slip and fall in the shower, and I woke up with bed bug bites all over my arms. If all of that sounds like fun, this is the place for you! Lol

Reviews.Title: “Clean and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Newfie12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid-October 2011 for 2 nights pre-bahamas cruise. Room was clean and service was very good. No problem accessing internet in their internet cafe - printer was easy to access/use. Breakfast was very good - wide assortment and has to have the best coffee of any hotel at which I have stayed. Located in a middle class area - close to airport. Latin cafe nearby had an excellent cuisine - loved the plantain soup. A bit removed from South Beach or Miami Beach - but we felt was good for price. Taxi wait on cruise day was a bit long - it was raining.

Reviews.Title: “My experience”
Reviews.Author: menendezalonso
Reviews.Content: my experience was really good, the workers are really nice, everything is nice and neat. i like it to much, im going to come back really soon... ahh something else, the two ladies that work in breakfast , they are nice and sweet.. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Contemporary”
Reviews.Author: BakerCan
Reviews.Content: For airport hotel and brief stay- this is will do! We arrived in the evening and took a taxi to the hotel which cost about $12. Check in was friendly and fast! Our room was clean, comfortable, and cool. Thank gosh for the Pantene toiletries because I was out of shampoo from our prior destination. The lobby has a business center and cold refreshements. I thought for the price and conveinence, this hotel was perfect for our one night layover. TV in hotel had HBO-- and plently of restaurants withing walking distance. We got our 5 am wake up call and caught the free shuttle tno airport. They offer free breakfast too, but we missed that. Impressed!

Reviews.Title: “vacation in miami”
Reviews.Author: sahaira M
Reviews.Content: this review covers our recent after cruise stay . hotel is new ,clean and bright. full free internet service

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: AshandBill
Reviews.Content: Extremely convenient to Miami International and the hotel offers a free shuttle which is great for people who are traveling. Very clean and comfortable rooms. Friendly employees. It was perfect for our layover.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Airport Convenience !!”
Reviews.Author: EMCG2011
Reviews.Content: We had a lengthy layover in Miami before an international flight and stayed at this place. A call to the front desk at 12:45 in the morning got us a shuttle ride from the airport to the hotel. When we arrived, Victor was manning the front desk. He was more than helpful and VERY polite and professional. We needed three rooms for our party and when Victor saw he only had two, he upgraded part of our party to a king sized suite. The room was clean and the grounds were well kept. The breakfast was the standard continental breakfast, but it was plentiful and fresh and the attending staff in the dining area was efficient and very friendly. Their performance along with VictorÂ´s attitude and pleasant demeanor was the icing on the cake for our short stay there. If we need to stay in Miami again, weÂ´ll definitely stay here. Thanks Victor and staff !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport hotel with great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Paul K
Reviews.Content: Arrived late in the day for a one night stay prior to a Celebrity cruise; I was impressed with both the hotel and the team of professionals working in the hotel. The hotel shuttle arrived for pick up at the airport 10 minutes after our call, on the phone they said about 15 minutes- a good start. At the front desk for check in was Victor; he handled the family ahead of us and then smiled and offered a Welcoming greeting prior to efficently handling the check in. Thought Victor went out of his way to explain late night dinner choices in the area, schedule the port shuttle for the next morning and then explain the hotel amenities... great job! The room was clean, modern and had several nice touches; the bed was great with lots of pillows. Breakfast in the morning was a good solid hotel breakfast with choices to please the entire family's taste buds. Impressive was the business center located right next to the breakfast area in the lobby; 3 computers to use, a big help. Check out in the morning was handled by Maylien; who had the receipt printed in no time, she had asked how we enjoyed our stay in the hotel and with a noon check out time and a noon shuttle pick up... it worked out great! We booked the stay on American Express travel and had gotten a great pre-pay price; but the stay was much better than expected, we will return to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracy H
Reviews.Content: Excellent room, fast internet, extremely accomodating staff at all hours. Nice gym, airport shuttle etc. What else can you ask for? Breakfast included to top it off, not fancy but more that adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, horrible location for a good night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Iridescentkittie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the pre-cruise package for a one-night stay in September 2011. The hotel itself is very nice - front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, rooms and common areas were quite clean and comfortable. Even the business center was nice, with 3 computers and printing services. Several options for lunch/dinner within walking distance, and I felt safe walking around. We called from the airport to request shuttle pickup, and the shuttle arrived within 15 minutes. The included breakfast was your average hotel breakfast - though I've had better options at other Fairfield Inns around the country. The reason I'm giving this hotel a 2-star rating is because of the noise level in the room. Sure, you can hear the planes taking off - this is to be expected. The problem was that there was some kind of club/restaurant nearby that played extremely loud music until at least 2am. We were on the top floor of the hotel - where presumably the street noise would be at its quietest - and it sounded like the band was right in our room. We had to blast the A/C and keep the tv on all night at a medium volume to drown out the bass. This was on a Friday night. I know the hotel can't control what other nearby properties do, but this was ridiculous. Fair warning to those looking to book on a weekend night! The other problem we had was with the shuttle service to the port on the morning of our cruise. We had a shuttle reservation for 12pm, so we took our time getting ready that morning. The shuttle driver called our room at 10:40, begging us to switch to the 11am shuttle! He said that the original 12pm shuttle we were booked on was definitely going to be running late, and that we needed to be on the 11am shuttle to be safe. We felt very rushed and were confused about why this was happening. I'm thinking this was probably a random, one-time thing - but I wanted to report my experience. This hotel was nice, but I won't be staying here again - I book hotels because I want to sleep at them, not listen to club music all night. Poor location.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Jullisa
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott member, so I always looks at their properties first. We needed a hotel for a long weekend in Miami. Marriott.com had a great deal on this hotel, so we took it. I had read the reviews on the safety issues and was a bit worried of what I would encounter. True the neighborhood is not the greatest. But I did not feel unsafe. All side access to the building were by key room only and I saw a security guard once when we arrived in the underground parking. Since we had not yet put up the hotel ticket on the dashboard, he was already walking towards us. The property is well maintained and very close to the airport. It lives up to the Marriott standard. As with most hotels in that area close the airport, we had to pay for parking. USD 10 a day. Staff was very friendly and room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was included, and even though it was basic, it was good enough.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hgaur
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the airport and also there is a free shuttle provided by the airport for the guests. I stayed here for a night in order to catch a morning flight to New york. The staff of the hotel, especially at the reception was kind and ready to help. I would say it is a good value hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice,Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: chantesinging
Reviews.Content: We Just got to Miami and this was our first night, the staff was VERY FRIENDLY! the room was clean and nice, the walls were thin,( we could hear the room next door talking on the phone) The breakfast they serve was GREAT, organized and lots of tables to sit and enjoy coffee in the morning, I did not use the pool this trip. One nice thing,there are places to eat right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “i was scared for my families welfare”
Reviews.Author: cidh
Reviews.Content: this was right outside the interstate, so you heard trucks all night. near the airport so you heard the planes overhead.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for overnighting near MIA airport”
Reviews.Author: INeedAVacationASAP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in June 2011. We chose this hotel because of the very positive reviews, it's proximity to the MIA airport, and the free breakfast. We loved staying here and would do so again. We called the hotel on Sunday night at 7:45 PM to request a shuttle pickup. The shuttle picked us up 10 minutes later. The ride to the hotel was just 5 minutes. Check in was fast and easy. We had a 2Q room (room 503) and it did not face the airport. The room was relatively quiet... just the low rumble from planes taking off. The beds were very comfy, the bathroom was clean, the TV was a a big flat screen, and the air conditioning worked perfectly. The decor was modern. The mini refrigerator made an annoying noise but we were able to sleep through it. We spent 10 minutes looking for the hair drier -- it wasn't mounted on the bathroom wall like at most hotels. It turns out it was hanging in a small bag in the closet. Overall we really liked our room. We went down for breakfast on Monday morning at 6:30 AM and the place was empty. It was continental, so no eggs or anything like that. There was a waffle maker but we didn't use it. The selection was decent but I would have prefered a hot breakfast. If I ever need to overnight at MIA again I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: HugoHobbs
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the quality of the room and the breakfast at the Fairfield inn close to the Miami airport. The hotel lobby and rooms have been resently remodeled in a bright, contemporary style. The hotel front desk employees were extremely helpful and friendly. There was a great breakfast selection and a USA today newpaper in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great place close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: gringatx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the way down and back from the keys. The staff is nice and friendly, the hotel is modern and clean, and the breakfast was good and had a nice variety. This was a lovely place to stay. We used the free shuttle from the airport. We used it again in the morning to go get a rental car, same way on our return trip to this hotel 5 days later. It worked out well. The room has queen-sized beds, which really make a difference in one's sleep with a little more space. There's a gas station next door that sells beer a lot cheaper than the beer in the lobby. There are restaurants all around you can walk to if needed. The pool is tiny - almost like a big hot tub. We didn't use it, but it would get crowded very quickly. The exercise room was sufficient. Overall, this is a very convenient place to stay if you are coming in late from the airport or leaving early for the airport. We got in at 10pm and left for the keys the next morning, so this place worked out just great! I highly recommend this Fairfield Inn. All Marriotts are non-smoking now, too.

Reviews.Title: “Over the moon.”
Reviews.Author: tamati
Reviews.Content: Arrived late from Aussie rang shuttle and was there in 10 minutes. Room was average size with 2 double beds and fridge. Bathroom was clean and had complimentary products, only thing wrong was tap and shower were loose but worked okay. Complimentary continental breakfast was excellent most would call it a full breakfast. At the price we got through booking.com was that good we were expecting a larger bill but this did not happen. A great start to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: TBotzon
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for one night after our cruise and after extensive research I chose this hotel. The staff was friendly the room clean and roomy. They allowed us to check in early and called up after we settled in and asked if we were happy with our room. Thats a first! The only problem I had was in the morning before we left I could not get the printer in the business area to work to print out our airline tickets to fly out. If I had it to do over again I would have done it the night before so I would have had time to get help to get them printed but we got out with out any problems. After we got home I realized that we accidentally forgot our Sonicare toothbrush in the bathroom. I called them and they had found it and I gave them my credit card to send it to us which they promptly did. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “clean tho NOISY”
Reviews.Author: JPNNH
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights awating a cruise. Very noisy outside my window...The pool (big bathtub actually) was supposed to close at 11PM per signs posted...A bunch of drunks decided to party there...at 2AM I contacted front desk & they said "We will send security there right away"...ya, sure....at 3:30 I finally dozed off with party still going on. Either the security was not on duty or he was too afraid to speak to the group. Left room at 9AM with housekeeper in hallway watching me leave, arrived back to room at 4PM to find it still had not been made up. I spoke to housekeeper (she had no clue as did not speak/understand English)....Grabbed a bar of soap off cart & told her forget it! Elevator inspection sign expired July 2010....(has it not been inspected since then???? If so where is the updated sign??? Breakfast not so good...Diabetic nightmare as only carbs could be found on counter...no meat...no eggs...all breads, muffins, bagels, cereal, jimmy Dean grease filled sandwiches.....VERY POOR healthy choices. Person cleaning tables, emptying trash & restocking food never changed her gloves the entire time I ate breakfast after doing all 3 chores...I wonder if glovers were for show or to protect her hands...they for sure were not for the customer protection. On plus side the hotel was clean...close to airport...shuttle arrived right away..desk clerks were friendly. For a quick fairly cheap nite its OK but NOT for a extended stay!

Reviews.Title: “Polystyrene plates, plastic cutlery”
Reviews.Author: MollyMac1
Reviews.Content: I can't fault this hotel as far as cleanliness, comfort and friendliness of staff is concerned. However, I wouldn't stay here again nor would I recommend it to anyone else for the simple reason that they use disposable cups, bowls, plates and cutlery for the self-service breakfast. I hate to think how much waste this hotel generates and I think it's irresponsible and inexcusable in the 21st century.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice & the rate is worth every cent and then some”
Reviews.Author: wisdom0220
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going on a cruise with another couple with another couple and flew into Miami early and stayed at the Fairfield Inn and Suites. We had issues at the airport and ended up in Miami even earlier than expected. The excellent staff (Mitch Betmudez & Liz) were so understanding, professional and helpful that they held onto our luggage for us (6 bags) pointed us to a local resturant for breakfast (which they were right it was a wonderful breakfast). When we returned they set us up in our rooms as early as they could, since we were all up for more than 24 hrs. Once we were all rested we had a wonderful dinner and enjoyed the hotels happy hour. The hotel is gorgeous, the art work and lobby are very modern. Our rooms were very clean and the bed was very comfortable. In the morning we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast which had a wide variety of breakfast items. We enjoyed our stay so much that we do plan on returning to see more of Miami and plan on staying there again. I truely hope this helps you in making your decision when deciding on a GREAT hotel while in Miami. I also read reviews prior to selecting the Fairfield Inn for our stay. It lived up to all that I read and so much more. A special thanks to Mitch and Liz for all that you did for us even though to you it might be a normal day. Well be back D. Jensen from California

Reviews.Title: “Pefect for budget business trip”
Reviews.Author: Blinkinsheep
Reviews.Content: Good free shuttle ( don't forget to tip the driver). Convenient to the airport without being trapped in the airport. Reception staff are all excellent. They deserve more paid holidays as a reward because they are great ambassadors to the Marriot Group. The hotel is close to a busy road junction but in a quiet residential road. The room was excellent and quiet. Very comfortable bed. Free local phone calls. The breakfast was excellent expecially the cook yourself deep waffles. The safe is free and well managed. There is free use of Internet computers which was such a help. The foyer is ideal for meeting people and coffee and iced water always on tap. There is a very good clean and resonably priced Latino Cafe just through the adjacent gas station. They also do take away and very good sandwiches. The Gas station sells milk. There are public buses into downtown but we were told that the service is not reliable. The main road junction near the hotel is intimidating, so best to walk down the quiet residential road opposite the hotel, which brings you out close to bus stops on both sides of the main road. The outdoor spar pool is small but excellent for a plunge. The only minus points were flyers pushed under the door in the small hours ( a towel stuffed under works) and the lifts are frustratingly slow to arrive. Use the stairs instead for a free workout. We would certainly use this hotel again, it is well run and user friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet hotel with friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: NJHucks
Reviews.Content: I booked in this hotel after our cruise, as we needed to fly out the next day. I wasn't expecting much since it was such a great price, but we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms are bright and clean, and quite large. The bed and linens were consistent with what we have found in hotels costing twice this price. Between the comfy bed and the quiet room we got the best night sleep of our whole vacation. The staff were great, always responded with a smile and provided helpful suggestions. Only drawback to this hotel is the location. It's great if you only want to go to and from the airport, but if you want to go to South Beach or downtown be prepared to spend 25+ for taxi fares each way. There is a great little Latin restaurant right around the corner from the hotel (cross through the gas station) that had awesome food at great prices. It's not fancy by any means, but the food was authentic, and great tasting.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but watch out for the local traffic.”
Reviews.Author: GreekGolfingGod
Reviews.Content: This Fairfield Inn was a good stop for my family as we were heading towards the Keys for Christmas Break. The hotel staff was very friendly and the rooms were spacious, clean, and quiet. The traffic can be very heavy to get to the hotel. The hotel is close to the airport but no issue with hearing the airplanes. We definitely liked the convenience to the downtown Miami area as we went to a Miami Heat game. The stadium is only 10 minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fairfield Inn-fierno”
Reviews.Author: mcl3
Reviews.Content: #1 - They charged $20 more than the base rate on my reservation (not including taxes and fees). They honored the reservation price after I complained. #2 - They only had ONE small elevator operating for 125 rooms! The wait for the elevator unreasonable as it was overloaded beyond capacity every time it came to the 5th floor. We had to lug 3 large suitcases and carry on luggage down 5 flights of stairs. The breakfast scene was alarming with hundreds of people preparing their own food in a small area. The area was unsanitary and every table was filthy. Marriott brand used to stand for excellence. How sad it was to see they are on the US corporate race to the bottom. After travelling around South America and experience great and friendly service at hotels it was very sad to return to a 3rd world US hotel like this. There is probably no hotel left in the world where you need to lug your luggage up or down 5 stories, except for this one in Miami. The place was at least clean and the cleaning ladies were friendly. If you need a place to stay before a flight it is not bad as long as you don't have much luggage and don't mind climbing stairs. If you are going or coming from a cruise, this place could be a real bummer.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alisha2008
Reviews.Content: We paid for the pre-cruise package from their website, which includes transportation to the port of Miami, and they would not honor it! We got suckered into staying at this hotel, paid the additional for the precruise package, and STILL had to pay an additional fee to get to the port. Also, the shuttle from the airport comes whenever they feel, not every hour as they claim. There is NO security, they had local residents walking thru the hotel slipping advertising papers under the doors. Seeing the neighborhood would make one uncomfortable with this. We were up all night with the loud sounds of traffic, people yelling, and firecrackers(gunshots maybe). We DID call Fairfield Inn Customer Service, and they're sending the complaint back to the hotel that would not work with us to fix this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Close. Just don't count on the shuttle if it's close to midnight”
Reviews.Author: gwilliamhouse
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a one night stay before a cruise. Close to the airport, clean hotel, nice rooms. Close to same location as three other Marriott, but still not a good neighborhood for walking around and exploring. There is nothing around except a scary neighborhood, and various local eating spots. It's mostly all hotels and commercial. They have a free shuttle from the airport, but it ends at midnight. (The close Residence Inn's shuttle ends at 1am). There are MANY flights into Miami that get in close to midnight, so I am not sure why Fairfield can't have their shuttle go at least until 12:30am or 1am. Our flight got in at 11:45 and as soon as I was off the plane, I called the hotel and talked to Victor and told him we were just off and waiting for luggage. He said that I was cutting it close (as if I had any control over the situation) and that I better hurry up because he was just about to send the shuttle driver on his last run of the night. I told him we were just getting the luggage and we would be as quick as possible. He told me to call when we had our luggage in hand. As we were waiting for our luggage, there was another traveler waiting who was on the phone. She was talking to someone saying she was waiting for her luggage, and that she had to get her luggage by midnight or she would miss her shuttle. She was telling the person on the other end of the line that she called the hotel and a rude guy answered and was not very helpful to her. When she hung up, I asked her if she was going to the Fairfield South and she said she was. I told her I talked to the same rude guy. We got our luggage at 11:55pm and I called and Victor told me the driver had already gone home and I needed to get a taxi. I asked him why would he have the driver go home when I had just called 10 minutes ago, saying I was there? Victor totally knew we were there and would be ready. Victor told me he sent the driver on his last run, and he came back with nobody waiting, and went home already. Hard to believe that in 10 minutes the driver started his run, finished his run and went home in that time frame. I told Victor I wanted to speak to the manager, and he said that he was the manager at the time and that I would have to wait to speak to someone else until the morning. Victor asked me what else he could do to help me, and I said I needed a shuttle. I asked him why he told the driver to go home when he knew I was there? He never answered only saying that I was not ready in time, and the driver had left, and I would have to take a taxi. I called the Residence Inn that was close and they told me they could not pick me up and drop me off at the Fairfield, even though they were close. (It requires about a one block walk, since there is a big wall in between both hotels, and we were not going to walk that with luggage and it being midnight) So we had to take a taxi. When we arrived, Victor acted like nothing happened. I again asked him why he sent the driver home knowing full well, we would be ready in like 5 minutes? Victor only said "the shuttle ends at midnight. There was nothing I could do." Hotel was great, and stay was good, but Victor was rude and not helpful at all. Funny, all the literature in the hotel says they are there to help me in anyway possible. "We promise" it says, and continues, "To make it right. No matter what" Uh huh, not this time! If you don't arrive after 11:30pm, and don't need to venture out on your own walking around the neighborhood (there is nothing there anyhow), then this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, not so nice hotel, bad neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: EricArthurBlair
Reviews.Content: I spent only one night at the hotel before an early flight next morning. The hotel rooms are nice, high quality bed linen, nice mattress, good bathroom. Everything is brand new, I felt like I was the first person using the room. However, the first impression was terrible. The hotel is located in the most scary neighborhood around the huge miami international airport. The reception clerk was not the most polite saying that If I don't use the hotel's garage (not free) that something would probably happen to it and the hotel wouldn't be responsible. The free breakfast was a joke. Only industrialized food. For this little staff threat and for the dangerous neighborhood, I wouldn't recommend it. Certainly there're better options around the airport as it is not the cheapest hotel in the area. And it definetely can't be considered for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: jkuo11
Reviews.Content: Staffs are incredible nice and helpfule even some of them speak little English. The best part is high speed wifi available in each room which is helpful for business trip person like me. Close to airport, only five to ten minutes driving distance, and easy access to high way. The only thing I can complain with is breakfast which is not diversity and fiber enough.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great location”
Reviews.Author: paradise58
Reviews.Content: We were shocked when we walked in to our room. It is decorated very well, updated. Very clean... It is a perfect location if you are flying out and you can park your car in their garage and take their shuttle back and forth to the airport. It is also only about 2 miles from Coral Gables which is the BEST place for shopping, restaurants, etc. If visiting that area and not wanting to spend the dollars for an expensive hotel, this hotel is a great option and reasonable on the wallet!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel for flights departing early”
Reviews.Author: doc_dance
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairfield Inn & Suites close to Miami Airport for one night after arriving back from the Florida Keys, in order to catch an early morning flight the next day. A convenient free shuttle bus picked me up at the airport where I dropped my rental car, and the same service brought me back to the check-in the next morning. The hotel itself as pretty average, I remember nothing really good or bad - maybe except for the thundering air conditioning unit in the room. Either you were frozen and deaf, or the Florida heat and humidity came through. Room was good sized with enough room for my pile of luggage. Breakfast was "continental" with plastic coffee from plastic cups, on plastic trays, accompanied by muffins wrapped in plastic and cereals - yes: In plastic packs. The huge pile of packaging material and plastic stuff that littered the table was amazing, and for my European taste there was only one solution: Get to the airport as quickly as possible..

Reviews.Title: “Business travelers..this hotel is not for you”
Reviews.Author: K2indy
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling for business, this hotel is not for you. There is no airport shuttle past midnight, and the front desk staff will offer no assitance if you are stuck at the airport. Once you make it to the hotel, then the shuttle only travels to the airport "15 minutes past each hour." That is certainly not convenient. So, fellow business travelers, spend the extra bucks and stay 2 blocks at the Marriott or Courtyard. If you are stuck at the airport and are staying at this hotel, call for the Marriott or Courtyard shuttle and walk the 2 blocks. The same is true if you miss the convenient "15 minutes past each hour" shuttle to the airport. I found the front desk staff not to be helpful and scoffed at my inquiry about obtaining or taking the Marriott or Courtyard shuttle. By the way I am a loyal Marriott frequent hotel stayer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place, Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jay083
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights during trip to S. Florida and Keys. Nice, fairly new building. Business center w/ 3 computers and printer was convenient. Staff was great - maintenance guy volunteered parts and tools to help me fix a broken wheel on a heavy suitcase - saved me from having to carry it around all week. Only (very minor) complaint is the pool/hot tub. It's too small to be a pool, but not nearly hot enough to be a hot tub. Most hotel hot tubs aren't hot enough, but this one was just lukewarm.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, quiet, altogether great value”
Reviews.Author: scottme
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights before heading west to a rented villa. This place was excellent in almost every respect. Closer to the airport than the car rental location, yet quiet and peaceful inside. Not "elegant" in that tacky way that so many expensive hotels are. At this place they just do the basics but they do them very well. Superbly comfortable beds, well equipped rooms, free wireless and wired Internet, complimentary breakfast, outdoor spa pool, fitness suite, and friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Two pleasant stays within a week”
Reviews.Author: thehamburgian
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairfield Inn twice as I had to attend a meeting in Boca Raton but only arrived late coming from overseas and left early going out again. I also wanted to have a look around in Miami as I've never been there before. The Fairfield Inn is very close to the airport, I think the taxi ride took me five minutes and cost me USD 10 as I understand around the airport a zone charge is applicable. Upon check in, I was warmly welcomed by the front desk clerk and checked in within short so I could get to my room and stretch out within short. Luckily I had a reservation as the receptionist had to turn down several people looking for rooms as their flights had been canceled. I just felt that merging the function of the concierge, bell boy, receptionist and telephone switchboard can be too much at times... The hotel itself is in a good shape, public areas as well as the rooms itself, understand from other reviews I studied prior booking that it is fairly new. The interior designer must have had a crush on green tones as this appears to be the dominating color but somehow it makes things look fresh. The rooms are spacious, the bathrooms too, and the beds are comfortable. Though the hotel is fitted with Wifi internet, each room is also equipped with LAN cables. Additionally, the hotel has a business center with high speed internet and a gym, though I only know this because I was made aware of this fact upon check in. The complimentary breakfast is somewhat basic but it provided me with all I required. Should one need to go to the nearby airport, the complimentary shuttle runs every 30 minutes. Am not so sure how airport pick ups as the driver told me that Miami Airport does not allow hotel buses to go to the arrival area but I guess there's a way to work around this, too. For travelers that might want to explore Miami and Miami Beach I trust there are hotels being more downtown but for those transiting from and to the airport this hotel is ideal. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CSLNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed over night and the hotel was everything it said it was going to be, We were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Loved It...............................”
Reviews.Author: candie_baker
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my mother and son for The Superbowl and everything was nice. Hotel staff especially Ms. May was sooooo nice. The hotel was nice, smelt good and clean. There was a water leak which the hotel had no control of and when we returned blowers, and fans were everywhere and but we were given another room and I must say the location was nice and the shuttle. Have nothing bad to say. YES, I would stay again. Ms. Baker from Minden, La.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Fairfield Inn we've found”
Reviews.Author: JoanieNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Staff more than accommodating as our flights were cancelled and what was to be a one-night stay turned into three. We were given adjoining suites with a crib for the youngest in newly redecorated rooms. Complementary breakfests included cereals to make-it-yourself waffles, choice of juices and other beverages, fruits and breakfast sandwiches and muffins in a nice setting. Free airport shuttle service. Gracious assistance with all of our requests really made what could have been a trying experience very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: Plexiaw
Reviews.Content: Stayed in December on an overnight layover in Miami; Hotel is within the nearest cab-fare zone ($10) and has an airport shuttle too, I believe it's about 2 miles from the airport. Customer service was fantastic, way above the level you'd expect at a Fairfield. Lobby is nice and has a business center with computers for use. Rooms are comfy and nice. Only drawback we had was that the planes fly over head and they can be loud; we were surprised they didn't use better sound-insulating windows. Plus: Customer service; New Hotel; Normal Fairfield value ammenities (internet, business center, breakfast, etc), Location Minus: Noise from jets location was PERFECT for an overnight stay near the airport but probably not a good spot for exploring the greater Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: JM11traveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Fairfield Inn!!!!!! This is a really nice hotel and its also brand new. They just recently finished building it in September. The lobby was nice and they also provide a complementary breakfast. The rooms are brand new with flat screen TV's and new designs but the beds are on the hard side. This hotel is also near the airport which is very convenient for some, but the area where the hotel is, is not so good. They have 3 other Marriott properties connecting to the Fairfield Inn which are nice as well. But if your in the Miami area anytime, I would recommend staying here!

HotelInfo.Name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Miami Airport South
HotelInfo.Address: 4101 Northwest 11th Street, Miami, FL 33126
